name: Pisco Sour
instructions:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled goblet glass.
description:
A pisco sour is an alcoholic cocktail of Peruvian origin that is typical of the cuisines from Peru. The drink's name comes from pisco, which is its base liquor, and the cocktail term sour, in reference to sour citrus juice and sweetener components.
The Peruvian pisco sour uses Peruvian pisco as the base liquor and adds freshly squeezed lemon juice, simple syrup, ice, egg white, and Angostura bitters.
The Chilean version is similar, but uses Chilean pisco and Pica lime, and excludes the bitters and egg white.
Other variants of the cocktail include those created with fruits like pineapple or plants such as coca leaves.
garnish: Few dashes of Amargo or Angostura bitters on top as an aromatic garnish.

ingredients.name: Pisco
ingredients.description:
Pisco is a type of brandy that originates from the winemaking regions of Peru and Chile. It is produced through the distillation of fermented grape juice, and its production is governed by strict regulations in both countries.

Pisco is typically distilled only once, which sets it apart from some other brandies that may undergo multiple distillations.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made with sugar and water. Usually in 1:1 or 2:1 ratio.

ingredients.name: Egg White
ingredients.description: Egg white is the clear liquid part of an egg that surrounds the yolk. It is rich in proteins and is commonly used in cooking and baking for its ability to add structure, foam, and a smooth texture to various dishes.
